The Chick: fil-A restaurant located in the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport opened on a Sunday, which is traditionally a day when all Chick-fil-A restaurants are closed.
The airport: s Twitter account tweeted photographs of Chick-fil-A's chicken sandwiches being handed out to passengers, providing visual evidence of the restaurant being open on a Sunday.
The CEO of Chick: fil-A, Dan Cathy, was pictured as one of the people giving out free food, further confirming the authenticity of the claim.
The company spokeswoman: Amanda Hannah, confirmed that Chick-fil-A employees mobilized on that Sunday to make sandwiches and deliver them to stranded passengers, emphasizing the company's willingness to open occasionally to serve communities in need.
